result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk:  jms
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Exp 12/27/2022

Defendant Christopher Deon Woodley Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Richard L. Voss Mr. appeared by video for Christopher Deon Woodley Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Ian Vance-Curzan in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense moves to dismiss the complaint. Arguments heard. Court denies the motion.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of 15JV880. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective A. Klabunde. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Christopher D. Woodley, Jr., Milwaukee County Jail - Pod 5A/Cell 8, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered defendant kept separate from Jamari S. (21CF5191) while in custody.

Defendant Christopher Deon Woodley in court with attorney David Thomas Conley.  Defendant Christopher Deon Woodley in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Deon Woodley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Due to co-defendant (21CF5191), Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
